tests.title: should return 401 if JWT token is missing
tests.fullTitle: PUT /orders/add should return 401 if JWT token is missing

tests.title: should add the product and update the cart (200)
tests.fullTitle: PUT /orders/add should add the product and update the cart (200)

err.message:
CypressError: `cy.request()` failed on:

http://localhost:8081/orders/add

The response we received from your web server was:

  > 401: Unauthorized

This was considered a failure because the status code was not `2xx` or `3xx`.

If you do not want status codes to cause failures pass the option: `failOnStatusCode: false`

-----------------------------------------------------------

The request we sent was:

Method: PUT
URL: http://localhost:8081/orders/add
Headers: {
  "Connection": "keep-alive",
  "accept": "application/json",
  "Content-Type": "application/json",
  "Authorization": "Bearer votre_token_jwt",
  "user-agent": "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Cypress/13.11.0 Chrome/118.0.5993.159 Electron/27.3.10 Safari/537.36",
  "accept-encoding": "gzip, deflate",
  "content-length": 28
}
Body: {"productId":1,"quantity":2}

-----------------------------------------------------------

The response we got was:

Status: 401 - Unauthorized
Headers: {
  "host": "localhost:8081",
  "connection": "close",
  "x-powered-by": "PHP/8.1.29",
  "www-authenticate": "Bearer",
  "cache-control": "no-cache, private",
  "date": "Thu, 27 Jun 2024 18:44:32 GMT",
  "content-type": "application/json",
  "x-robots-tag": "noindex"
}
Body: {
  "code": 401,
  "message": "Invalid JWT Token"
}
